pr_title: change RNTBD defaults as per learning and to be in par with .Net

timeline.message: change RNTBD defaults as per learning from customer

timeline.bodyText:
Isn't this too much ?
For big customers, who have very high number of physical partitions - like around 500 or 1000. Then this will always create that many connections -> physical partitions * 4 (which is the number of replicas) - and will keep the resources occupied for 24 hours even if we don't need them.
timeline.author: kushagraThapar

replies.bodyText:
see the .Net default:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/microsoft.azure.documents.client.connectionpolicy.idletcpconnectiontimeout?view=azure-dotnet#Microsoft_Azure_Documents_Client_ConnectionPolicy_IdleTcpConnectionTimeout
having 70 seconds as timeout certainly cause latency issue. and a big customer with those many partitions certainly wants a good latency.
We can think about what the good default should be 70 seconds is too low.
replies.author: moderakh
David-Noble-at-work

replies.bodyText:
Agreed, 70 seconds is too low from what we have seen so far.
But In my opinion, 24 hours is a lot. It will just occupy many resources that we don't want the code to retain if they are not being used.
May be start with 1 hour ?
@kirankumarkolli @David-Noble-at-work thoughts ?
replies.author: kushagraThapar

replies.bodyText: 1h seems a good start. changed to 1h.
replies.author: moderakh

replies.bodyText:
One single configuration value doesn't fit for all CX needs.
My first thoughts are we will have few top usage profiles (covering some trade-off's) which gives the CX the easier way to pick and choose. @David-Noble-at-work is exploring those opitions.
Till then parity with .NET might be reasonable middle ground.
Also pinged Hemant offline for his opinion.
replies.author: kirankumarkolli
